items.sentence: Nothing would make me happier than to see you happy.
One of the people you were with is a friend of mine.
Good words are worth a lot, but cost almost nothing.
Tom didn\'t have the courage to go there by himself.
Tom didn\'t know that Mary had already bought bread.
Tom didn\'t know that Mary knew how to speak French.
Tom didn\'t notice that Mary was sitting by herself.
I found myself doing things I thought I never would.
I gave Tom and Mary a present for their anniversary.
I gave some of my old clothes to the Salvation Army.
I get a three percent commission on anything I sell.
I get nervous when I speak in front of large crowds.
It\'s a pity that I don\'t understand French better.
Tom opened the curtains slightly and looked outside.
Tom opened the sliding door to let John and Mary in.
Tom parked his car in an underground parking garage.
Tom was hospitalized with life-threatening injuries.
Tom was killed three days ago in a traffic accident.
Tom was not surprised by what he read in the report.
Tom was on vacation with his son when his wife died.
I\'m afraid I don\'t understand what you\'re saying.
At that time, Tom was sitting between Mary and John.
Did Tom tell Mary where she was supposed to meet us?
Do you really think Tom will come back to Australia?
Can you briefly sum up what was said at the meeting?
I\'m not interested in hearing any of your theories.
Can you manage to complete the manuscript by Friday?
Can you please help me put price tags on everything?
Can you please take this package to the post office?
Can you teach me how to play the guitar like you do?
Tom said he needed to get up early tomorrow morning.
Tom said he saw Mary sitting in the park by herself.
Tom wasn\'t happy with the way he was being treated.
I wish I could change places with Tom, but I can\'t.
I wish I hadn\'t eaten the sandwich Tom made for me.
What\'s the most disgusting food you\'ve ever eaten?
Don\'t ask me to choose between you and my children.
Don\'t do anything to attract attention to yourself.
Don\'t forget to take your umbrella when you go out.
I still think we should\'ve gone to Boston with Tom.
I suppose I\'d better be more careful the next time.
I suppose I\'d better go and talk to Tom about that.
Tom isn\'t the type of person I want working for us.
I heard that Tom doesn\'t live in Australia anymore.
I suppose you\'ll need a crowbar to open that crate.
Tom did a good job proofreading Mary\'s rough draft.
I thought you said Tom wasn\'t a member of our club.
I thought you said you didn\'t want to be disturbed.
How do you help someone who doesn\'t want your help?
Tom has told me he has to go to Australia next week.
